title: Sampler, 1826
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on wool foundation
Technique: counted and uncounted stitches; cross, satin, back, stem, and couching on plain weave foundation
creditline: Bequest of Rosalie Coe, from the collection inherited from her mother, Eva Johnston Coe
description:
Curving floral border enclosing letters, parts of an alphabet, floral bands, initialed crowns, and a verse: 
"Give her the fruit of her hands and let her work praise her in the gates, Mary Muro 1826"
with a large house overshadowed by trees at the bottom. The trees and grass have been worked in chenille yarns.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1826.
1826. Medium: silk embroidery on wool foundation
Technique: counted and uncounted stitches; cross, satin, back, stem, and couching on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Rosalie Coe, from the collection inherited from her mother, Eva Johnston Coe. 1974-42-7.
